title: Pogostick...
content:
I posted this before, but never got an answer before all the topcis were deleted.

"How did the vorticons get ahold of the pogostick in the first place? And why was it mounted on top of a pyramid like a god or a trophy?"[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pogo.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

title: Re: Pogostick...
content: In the story for Commander Keen 1, it is mentioned that the Vorticons worshipped Earth toys... you'll notice all of the other Earth items scattered throughout the Keen games. The two pogo sticks obviously came from the toys the Vorticons collected. (Yes, there are two pogo sticks in Keen 1).[url=http://www.screenhog.com]www.screenhog.com[/url]

title: Re: Pogostick...
content: ah. ok. thanks; must not have seen that in the game text things

title: Re: Pogostick...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]there are two pogo sticks in Keen 1[hr][/quote]
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] !?!?! WHERE???Couldn't he just use the pogo!?

title: Re: Pogostick...
content: [quote]Quote:[hr]WHERE???[hr][/quote]There's one in the [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/maps/maps-k1-lvl05.html]pogo level[/url] and one at the bottom of the [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/maps/maps-k1-lvl16.html]ice level[/url].

title: Re: Pogostick...
content: The whole game can be completed without pogo except one jump in the last level that requires pogo. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] That's why there's a pogo in that level.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Pogostick...
content: Wow.Couldn't he just use the pogo!?

title: Re: Pogostick...
content:
the vorticons didnt worship toys. Marians did.
Vorticons and martians have no relations.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: Pogostick...
content: By "martians" you probaly mean Gargs and Yorps, but there are also Vorticons on Mars, and they have stolen Keen's ship parts. (I'm a genius! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-disguised.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] )Couldn't he just use the pogo!?

title: Re: Pogostick...
content: but they dont own the pogo stick[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: Pogostick...
content:
Nor are they Martians, and I think the story does say the Martians took the toys, not the visiting Vorticons.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Re: Pogostick...
content:
and where is the secret telliporter?
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img]

title: Yay! 2 spoilers in 1 day!
content:
Go to the level with the big maze (its on the east side of mars by itself, the gray level. You start out by a garg and some ammo) and go to a part where you can fall down a hole into a dark area with fire.
go to the right and find a secret brick (all you can see is the upper left pixel)
jump over to the side with the cannon
now time it right and have the cannon blast you to the other side.
oh and be careful of the tank bot![img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: Yay! 2 spoilers in 1 day!
content: No, I thought it was the Yorps who worshipped Earth toys?I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Yay! 2 spoilers in 1 day!
content: Both yorps AND gargs, who are both martians. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img]  [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: Yay! 2 spoilers in 1 day!
content:
But mostly Yorps. Gaargs aren't that smart you see, and spent most of their time worshipping a warlike half Garg/half chicken god called Hsur-Neek.A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Yay! 2 spoilers in 1 day!
content:
Willkommen zu Intergal, Intergalactic Encyclopaedia.

Intergal, for all you referencing needs!

Entry 14419G-314:

Intellect v3.14

The Intellect 3.14 is the second newest version of the Intellect gigacomputer series produced by Djaz [ltd] of the planet Vorticon V.

The 3.14 version has an accelerative computing power of over 1.4 million teraflops per second per second and is able to control gigastructures such as large industrial complexes. Over 9.3 million of the 1.4 ton units were exported before the series discontinuation. [See below.] Mostly to be used in food production facilities. [Chungella IV importing nearly half the supply]

The 3.14 series was discontinued in 24 AI [After Intergal] due to a PR disaster where 8 functional units were installed in a z-class battleship that was almost successful in destroying an M-class planet. Due to a misprint the date was shown as one week after the event, and in the event the planet was not destroyed, dissapointing those who managed to arrive in time.

The new 3.15 model can be ordered from any Vitacorp or Intergal general aquirement locality.A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord
